result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase L. LaRocque was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 1, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Restitution shall be determined within 30 days of plea and sentencing.
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim E.B.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim E.B. due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber. The jail sentence shall begin immediately. The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence

records.addlTxt: 9:00 AM Defendant Chase L. LaRocque in court, in custody.    Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Mr. LaRocque would like to take the offer.  Court will be appointing Attorney Bernardo Cueto to represent Chase L. LaRocque.  Attorney Cueto will meet with Mr. LaRocque later this morning.  Reconvene at 10:49 am. Appearances are the same as earlier except Attorney Cueto is in court representing the defendant.  Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2 Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of 1 and 3.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Cueto.   Court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for three years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution to be determined within 30 days; no contact with E.B.; letter of apology to E.B. due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; 39 days sentence credit; 30 days jail on each count concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence.  The costs  shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 1, 2022 - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Chase L. LaRocque in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim notification has been complied.  Defendant is eligible for a public defender.  Court questions defendant regarding the procedures of an arraignment.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney for this hearing.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to all charges.  Defendant would like bond modified to a half cash and half signature bond. Statement by defendant.   Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court does not modify bond.  Pretrial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 9:00 am.  Status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am. - rt
State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

11:35 AM Defendant Chase L. LaRocque in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Chase L. LaRocque in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim notification has been complied.  Victim is present in the courtroom.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Arraignment to be scheduled for a later date.  Attorney Paul would like the bond modified.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court continues the bond as previously ordered.  Court orders defendant to pay $25.00 a month towards the attorney fees beginning 30 days after release from custody.  Arraignment scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am. - rt
to Reimburse County for Attorney's Fees
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  No entering the Blazel property on Diamond Drive, Lublin, WI; No contact with E.R.B.  DOB: 7/26/1981, A.L.K.  DOB: 8/9/1999, E.D.E.  DOB: 8/12/2001 or I.S.M.  DOB: 9/18/2000200

01:15 PM Defendant Chase L. LaRocque in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim is present in the courtroom.   Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.  District attorney requests a cash bond in the amount of $5,000.00. No entering the Blazel property on Diamond Drive, Lublin, WI; No contact with E.R.B.  DOB: 7/26/1981, A.L.K.  DOB: 8/9/1999, E.D.E.  DOB: 8/12/2001 or I.S.M.  DOB: 9/18/2000.  Statement by defendant requesting a signature bond.  Court sets $2,000.00 cash bond with the same conditions as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Defendant is not waiving his time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 11:30 am. - rt
